description: A traditional festival held in Kyoto, featuring a procession of people dressed in ancient court attire.
A festival dedicated to the Kamo deities, celebrated with a procession and various rituals.

The pottery fair or festival at Mashiko started in 1966. It is held two times a year in spring during the Golden Week holidays (late April to early May) and in autumn in November. Approximately 500 tents dealers and about 50 permanent pottery stores line the main street of Mashiko's Jonaizaka Street for about 500 meters. Mashiko potteries are sold from traditional Mashiko earthen wares such as daily necessities cups and dishes to artistic pottery products.

festival_name: Meiji Jingu Shrine Annual Spring Festival
description: The shrine is dedicated to the memory of the Emperor Meiji and his wife Empress Shoken. The festival includes various ceremonies and performances.

This is the festival of Sumiyoshi Shrine in Ohme City. On May 2, twelve festival floats parade their towns and all floats gather in front of JR Ome Station after three p.m. On May 3, twelve floats parade along the Ome Kaido street.
A festival at Okunitama Shrine in Fuchu, where the mikoshi (portable shrine) is paraded at midnight after all city lights are turned off.
The origin of the festival goes back to 1841 when a Buddhism priest told the village people about a kite flying to pray for a bumper harvest.
Kazo City produces about 50% of koinobori in Japan. The giant koinobori is about 100 meters long and weighs 350 kilograms.
A festival celebrating bonsai culture in Omiya Bonsai Village, featuring over 100 bonsai shops.
A major festival year with town mikoshi parading.
A major festival year with a huge mikoshi of Karasumori Shrine parading.
Features a parade of Samurai warriors in armors commemorating Fujiwara Hidesato.
One of the three big shrine festivals of Tokyo, known for its wild and large scale.
Includes yabusame (horseback archery) and a procession of 1,000 Samurai.
A popular early summer event in downtown Ueno.
A major festival year with a parade of shrine mikoshi.
A major festival year with a grand parade.
